title: Blink-182 explain how name is actually pronounced - and address line-up change

Blink-182 revealed how their name is actually pronounced on today's Good Morning Britain.

There has been some confusion over the proper pronunciation of the punk rock band's name - with some opting for one-eight-two, and others going for one-eighty-two.

Band members Mark Hoppus and Matt Skiba addressed the confusion over their name during a chat with Kate Garraway and Ben Shephard.

Mark explained: "We say one-eighty-two because we’re American but when we got to Australia and the UK people say one-eight-two."

Matt added: "I think it has more to do with English/American pronunciation of numbers."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Getty)

Some Good Morning Britain viewers were left baffled by the change in the line-up.

Travis Baker, who was involved in a plane crash in 2008, was not in the studio as he had not flown over to the UK.

Alkaline Trio guitarist and singer Matt joined the band in 2015 when they reformed without Tom DeLonge.

Discussing his role, Matt said: "It's amazing. It's very surreal. When Mark and Travis asked me to play with them I was immediately thrilled and excited but also waiting for the joke.

"I thought someone was playing a joke on me. It's been that way. Avery beautiful joke. It hasn’t been a joke at all. It's amazing."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Mark, who lived in London for three years and supported Chelsea, declared his love for the country.

He said: "When we first stared coming over here, London specifically took in our trio before the rest of the world.

"This is very much a second home for me. I’ve been in love with this country for a couple of decades now and love coming here."

(Image: ITV)

Good Morning Britain viewers took to Twitter after seeing the changed line-up.

One viewer said: "What! Blink 182 on #GMB ! Would it be polite to say they’ve certainly aged! why are they still trying to look 22

Another asked: "Is that really the lead singer?"

A third said: "He's not Tom the lead singer.... Stand in klaxon "

*Good Morning Britain airs weekdays on ITV at 6am
description: Mark Hoppus and Matt Skiba addressed the confusion over their name - and GMB viewer spotted a change in their line-up
